docs.snippet: For the DeWitt family, whose roots in baseball reach back nearly a century, keeping with tradition in running the Cardinals is a priority....
docs.lead_paragraph: For the DeWitt family, whose roots in baseball reach back nearly a century, keeping with tradition in running the Cardinals is a priority.
docs.abstract: Tyler Kepner On Baseball column holds that the DeWitt family, whose roots in baseball reach back nearly a century, maintain strong focus on tradition in running the St Louis Cardinals; notes that bill DeWitt Jr bought the Cardinals for $150 million in 1995.

headline.main: Cardinals’ History Remains in the Details
headline.print_headline: Cardinals’ Owners Make Sure Team’s History Remains in Details

docs.snippet: David Ortiz played only six games at first this season, but with the World Series shifting to St. Louis, where designated hitters won’t appear, he will start there Saturday....
docs.lead_paragraph: David Ortiz played only six games at first this season, but with the World Series shifting to St. Louis, where designated hitters won’t appear, he will start there Saturday.

headline.main: Ortiz Will Play First Base for Red Sox in Game 3

docs.snippet: Crowds of emotional fans have often created a memorable pandemonium after the winning of a pennant or a World Series....

docs.snippet: With Pedro Martinez in attendance, Carlos Martinez, a young right-hander called Little Pedro, threw two scoreless innings on Thursday to preserve the Cardinals’ Game 2 victory....
docs.lead_paragraph: With Pedro Martinez in attendance, Carlos Martinez, a young right-hander called Little Pedro, threw two scoreless innings on Thursday to preserve the Cardinals’ Game 2 victory.
docs.abstract: St Louis Cardinals young right-handed pitcher Carlos Martinez, sometimes called Little Pedro in reference to pitching great Pedro Martinez, threw two scoreless innings to preserve Game 2 victory over Red Sox; game was attended by Pedro Martinez himself, who was being honored as member of Boston's 2004 championship team.

headline.main: Martinez, This One a Cardinal, Sets Them Down at Fenway
headline.print_headline:
At Fenway, an Enemy
With a Familiar Look

docs.snippet: A guard for the Boston Celtics in the 1950s, Sharman went on to lead the Lakers to their first N.B.A. title in Los Angeles, in 1971-72, and is credited with introducing the morning shootaround....
docs.lead_paragraph: A guard for the Boston Celtics in the 1950s, Sharman went on to lead the Lakers to their first N.B.A. title in Los Angeles, in 1971-72, and is credited with introducing the morning shootaround.
docs.abstract: Bill Sharman, who was elected to Basketball Hall of Fame twice for his roles as a player for the Boston Celtics player and Los Angeles Lakers coach, dies at age 87.

headline.main: Bill Sharman, Two-Time Basketball Hall of Famer, Dies at 87
headline.print_headline: Bill Sharman, 87, Two-Time Hall of Famer

docs.snippet: When does a flesh-and-blood N.F.L. player become more than a mere fantasy football commodity?...
docs.lead_paragraph: When does a flesh-and-blood N.F.L. player become more than a mere fantasy football commodity?
docs.abstract: Essay by author and fantasy football expert C D Carter suggests that the very nature of fantasy football dehumanizes the players at the center of the game; cites example of Minnesota Vikings star running back Adrian Peterson, whose value as a fantasy football commodity came into question after real-life tragedy involving death of his 2-year-old son.

headline.main: Living in a World of Fantasy Can Be Dehumanizing
headline.print_headline: Living in a World of Fantasy Can Be Dehumanizing

docs.snippet: The president went to the Pathways in Technology Early College High School, which he mentioned in his State of the Union address this year, to talk about education....
docs.lead_paragraph: The president went to the Pathways in Technology Early College High School, which he mentioned in his State of the Union address this year, to talk about education.
docs.abstract: Pres Obama visits Pathways Technology Early College High School, innovative Brooklyn high school that he praised in his 2013 State of the Union address; he will deliver message about urgency of education reform in global economy.

headline.main: Obama, at Brooklyn School, Pushes Education Agenda
headline.print_headline: President Pushes Education Goals at a Brooklyn School

keywords.value: Pathways in Technology Early College High School (P-TECH)
keywords.name: organizations

docs.snippet: Six years after being beaten and burned beyond recognition, Carmen Tarleton is adjusting to a transplanted face....
docs.lead_paragraph: Six years after being beaten and burned beyond recognition, Carmen Tarleton is adjusting to a transplanted face.
docs.abstract: Carmen Tarleton, who was beaten and burned beyond recognition with industrial lye in an 2007 attack by her ex-husband, is adjusting to face transplant she received in February 2013; describes how the operation, which is still an experimental procedure, was both surgically and psychologically challenging, forcing her and her loved ones to get used to an entirely new countenance.

headline.main: For Victim of Ghastly Crime, a New Face, a New Beginning
headline.print_headline: For Victim of Ghastly Crime, A New Face, a New Beginning
